item.name: Files
item.description: Files endpoints interact with the file object, which is associated with (and points to) a job.

description.content:
Bulk import must be in a standardized format.

Using this endpoint, you can generate the template required to bulk import attribute, category, collection, item, and/or bundle.

item.name: Get files available for a merchant

request.name: Get files available for a merchant

description.content:
Get files available for a merchant. This endpoint can be used to search for files using file names or file IDs.

**Note**: Query parameter `ids` cannot be combined with any other query parameters and pagination is not supported when `ids` query is used.

Supports up to 15 comma-separated job IDs

**Note**:
1. This parameter cannot be combined with any other query parameter.
2. Pagination is not supported when this parameter is used.
File name
File types
Number of records to skip before returning records. For example, `offset=20, limit=10` returns records 21-30.
Maximum number of records per page

Sorting criteria. Supported values are `updatedAt` and `name`.

**Note**: `-` refers to descending and `+` refers to ascending order

Supports up to 15 comma-separated job IDs

**Note**: The link is valid only for five minutes.

item.name: Jobs

Bulk import of attributes must be in a standardized format.

This endpoint gets the template required to bulk import attributes.

Get a paginated list of jobs related to products by specifying the query parameters such as job `ids`, `type`. You can refine the results by specifying `offset` and `limit`.

**Note**:
1. Query parameter `ids` cannot be combined with the rest of the query parameters and when it's specified, pagination is not supported.
2. Query parameter `inputFileIds` supports up to 15 comma-separated file IDs and it can be combined only with the query parameter `lastJobOnly`. Pagination is not supported when this parameter is used.

Supports up to 15 comma-separated job IDs

**Note**:
1. This parameter cannot be combined with any other query parameter.
2. Pagination is not supported when this parameter is used.
Job types

Supports up to 15 comma-separated file IDs.

**Note**:
1. This can only be combined with the query parameter `lastJobOnly`.
2. Pagination is not supported when this parameter is used.

true: The last job that meets the query parameters
false: Not necessarily the last job

**Note**: Only applicable with `type` and `inputFileIds`.
Number of records to skip before returning records. For example, `offset=20, limit=10` returns records 21-30.
Maximum number of records per page

fabric's **Files** and **Jobs** APIs support bulk import and export of items, attributes, and bundles.

To begin with importing, download the appropriate template for the specific `type` of import. A standardized template ensures consistency in data structure and formatting. It also helps enforce data validation rules to ensure imported data meets the specified criteria and reduces the chance of incorrect and inaccurate information.

Once you have completed filling out the import details in the template, add the file name and `type` in the request body of the `POST /files/product` endpoint. The response will provide you with the URL where you can upload the file for importing. After successfully importing the file, you can utilize the job exports endpoints to export the imported products and attributes based on specified criteria. Contact Support: Name: Product team Email: support@fabric.inc
